page.title: 09MACCLESFIELD CANAL
page.content: The canal goes from Stoke-on-Trent to Marple.In our area it is 5m wide generally and is used mainly by narrow boats cruisers and speedboats.There is a marina which contains 107 private boats,each boat paying Â£1.15p for 3 months mooring fee.Improvements,such as painting and renewing fences,laying new towpaths and verges and supplying new seats,have been made recently.On 18th May the Chairman of British Waterways came to unveil a plaque to celebrate the improvements. Nearby is Brookbank Canoeing Centre,where people learn how to sail canoes and kayaks. Elmwood Nature Reserve has just been created close to the canal and has attracted lots of wildlife.Two caravan and camp sites and a public house, the Boars Head, are used by holidaymakers.
